✅ Bring some snacks & water for a relaxed visit

If you're looking for a peaceful retreat with a touch of adventure, this park is a must-visit in Barcelona! 🌿🏛️ Would definitely go back! 😊

This park offers a delightful escape filled with winding paths and lush greenery, making it a perfect outing for families, especially those with kids. The maze is a big hit, encouraging playful exploration and sparking the imagination of little ones as they weave through the tall hedges. It's not just about the maze; the whole area is well-maintained, providing plenty of space for picnics and relaxation, while the beautiful gardens add to the charm of the experience.

Parents will appreciate the safe environment, allowing children to roam freely as they burn off some energy. The serene atmosphere combined with the vibrant colors of the plants creates a refreshing break from the hustle and bustle of the city. Overall, it's a lovely place that fosters both fun and tranquility for visitors of all ages.

If you want to go to a less crowded park than the ciutadella park, this one is the right one. It's a small, labyrinth designed park that is a little bit far from the center of Barcelona but worth a visit.

places.address: Passeig dels Castanyers, 1, Horta-Guinardó, 08035 Barcelona, Spain

places.generalDescription: Hotel 1898 is a luxurious hotel housed in a restored 19th-century building, which was once a tobacco factory. The hotel features a stunning rooftop terrace called La Isabela, offering breathtaking views of Barcelona. Guests can enjoy the indoor pool and escape the bustling city below. The colonial design adds to the historic charm of this 4-star hotel located on the famous Ramblas street. With its Mediterranean-style restaurant and open-air bar terrace, Hotel 1898 offers an excellent dining experience.

sources.snippet: When you walk through the doors of Hotel 1898, you step back in time. You’ll feel as if you and your partner are being whisked away into an old Hollywood movie. The classic lounge furniture inside the main foyer is enough to make you want to grab a drink and stay, however, head up to the terrace for the highlight.
sources.shortName: 15 Hidden Romantic Spots in Barcelona for Couples

places.name: Hotel 1898

reviews.text:
Everything about this hotel is wonderful!  Attentive and friendly staff, superb location and a feel of elegant opulence! Our room was beautiful, cleaning staff were also really lovely and helpful.
The roof terrace is a haven of tranquility,  a welcome space to chill and have a swim after a busy, hot day of sightseeing.
Breakfast was an array of tasty delicacies, served in a very grand dining area.
As we had a late evening flight home we stored our luggage at hotel for the day and we were allowed to use all facilities until we left.
We will definitely be back and have recommended this hotel to friends and family.

So, what can I say about this place and the service my family received this past week...absolutely wonderful!!! Booked this place for my mothers 60th and right from the first day when checking in, staff where attentive, so helpful and knowledgeable!

The hotel is so clean, smells amazing (wish I knew what they used), in a great location with everything you could want nearby. The room cleaners do a fantastic job everyday and the breakfast buffet selection is absolutely divine!

So much variety and choice, so you can easily try something new everyday and not feel bored. They constantly come around asking if you are OK and need anything else and offer to make fresh omelettes etc.

Without even asking, they surprised my mother during breakfast with champagne, chocolate cake and a song and when they came back to their room later that night, had a whole bottle and another slice of cake waiting for them which was delicious and so thoughtful!

The staff are so knowledgeable and friendly and know the area really well and have great recommendations for places to go visit and eat at and everything was spot on!

A massive thank you to Iris who worked the front desk at reception, as she was the one I spoke to the most and was an amazing member of staff who was always smiling and helped our family enjoy our stay this week.

Also, a big thank you to Ana, who works in the dining area, who was always on hand during breakfast, made sure everything was spotless and ran smoothly. I got to say thank you to Ana but not Iris unfortunately, so please give them both something special on behalf of my family.

Will definitely recommend this place to colleagues, family and friends in the future and I hope to visit some day again! Thank you Hotel 1898!

Amazing hotel.
Staff very friendly, rooftop pool and bar is great.
Lobby smells amazing  wish I knew what it was, forgot to ask as we checked out.
Rooms very clean and bed comfy.
Central location.
Don't have anything bad to say and can't wait to come back.

places.address: La Rambla, 109, Ciutat Vella, 08002 Barcelona, Spain

places.generalDescription: Perched atop the hills of Barcelona, Bunkers El Carmel is a hidden gem offering a 360-degree panoramic view of the city. Once a shelter during the Spanish Civil War, this site has become a popular spot for watching breathtaking sunsets and capturing stunning photographs. While it's best to avoid crowds by visiting on foot and during the day, the effort is rewarded with an unforgettable experience.

sources.snippet: Located on the outskirts of the city, towards the hills of Colserolla Park, the Bunkers del Carmel have for a long time been among Barcelona’s best-kept secrets. These abandoned war-time bunkers offer probably the best panoramic view of Barcelona you can find. There’s nothing else there, and the site is open to the public at all times, so you’re free to plan sunrise breakfasts and late night picnics as you wish.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots In Barcelona

sources.snippet: An even better option is to head up to the Bunkers de Carmel, although, in recent years, the ‘hidden lookout’ is far from hidden anymore. The view over Barcelona from the Bunkers is stunning, but I’d recommend a more magical spot if you’re looking to infuse the panoramic view with some romance. The Observatori Fabra is on Mount Tibidabo, accessible with Ferrocarrils, in under 20 minutes from Plaza de Cataluña.
sources.shortName: 15 Hidden Romantic Spots in Barcelona for Couples

sources.snippet: This is a viewpoint from which you can observe a 360-degree panorama of Barcelona and the Mediterranean Sea. For many years, it was one of Barcelona’s best-kept secrets but now has become famous as one of the most romantic destinations for couples in the city. Interesting fact – despite its name, there have never been any actual bunkers at the site which was formerly used to house anti-aircraft machinery.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Barcelona

sources.snippet: Few locals and tourists know about this spot, which means it won’t be crowded and instead you and your partner can snuggle up and take in the views. The place is found in the district of El Carmel and it’s from the viewpoint of Turo de la Rovira. Bring a blanket and a bottle of wine and watch the sunset while you snuggle close to your partner.
sources.shortName: The 5 Most Romantic Things To Do In Barcelona

sources.snippet: The Bunkers of Carmel is another must-visit place for couples who are in Barcelona, just alone for the views it offers of the city. It is located at a height of 262 meters in the Carmel neighbourhood. You can see a 360-degree view from the Bunkers of Carmel along with Barcelona’s landmarks like La Sagrada Familia and Parc Guell.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Romantic Places in Barcelona

sources.snippet: When you’re not clambering down to your hotel’s breakfast bar, take a walk and have a romantic breakfast at Bunker del Carmel. Bunker del Carmel is a Spanish Civil War anti-aircraft bunker atop Turó de la Rovira, offering near-birds-eye panoramic views over the city. This is one of the most romantic places in Barcelona.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic things to do in Barcelona

sources.snippet: Most people don’t associate war with romance, but Bunkers Del Carmel is an outlier in that way. These Spanish Civil War Bunkers, which had anti-aircraft guns installed within the bunkers, offer a present-day incredible –– and romantic –– viewing point. Go to Bunkers Del Carmel to watch the sunset with your love.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Barcelona

sources.snippet: This hidden gem is another of the truly romantic places in Barcelona to propose. With spectacular views of the city, this location is perfect for a sunset proposal. Located at the top of Turó de la Rovira it is secluded and off the beaten path, making it an intimate spot for a proposal.
sources.shortName: The Top Romantic Places in Barcelona to Propose

sources.snippet: It offers a gorgeous sunset setting with a bird’s-eye view of Barcelona, which looks like the sea of light at night. You can reach it either using public transportation or taxi, and a 5 minute hike will take you to the top. Known by the locals, it has increased its popularity lately.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Barcelona

sources.snippet: I know that you probably won't find anything romantic in the remains of the trenches where some people were hidden during wartime, but I assure you that with the view of Barcelona from up there, nothing more could make you want to have the right person at your side!
sources.shortName: The 5 Most Romantic Places in the City of Barcelona

sources.snippet: El Bunkers del Carmel is a beautiful viewpoint that offers stunning city views. Couples can take a romantic walk up the hill and enjoy the beautiful scenery or take a picnic and enjoy the views from one of the many lookout points.
sources.shortName: Couples in Barcelona: 6 Unique Date Ideas

sources.snippet: For a panoramic view of Barcelona, head to El Bunkers del Carmel. The sweeping vistas of the city set an impressive stage for your proposal, offering a moment that's both grand and intimate.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Enchanting Places to Propose in Barcelona
15 Things to Do for Traveling Couples
8 Romantic Things to do in Barcelona

places.name: Bunkers del Carmel

reviews.text: One of the best views in Barcelona, hands down. The hike up is a bit of a workout, especially on a hot day, but totally worth it once you're at the top. You get a full panoramic view of the city - from the beach to the mountains - and it's absolutely stunning. It's a chill spot, lots of people hanging out with snacks or drinks, and it has a relaxed, local vibe. No entrance fee, just good views and good vibes.

Hiking with a view! This hidden gem (not so hidden anymore) is a perfect place to have a picnic while watching the sunset. Far from touristy places and traditional must visits in Barcelona, this place is a perfect combo of a hiking trip leading to a perfect view spot of Barcelona.

A nice place if (like me) you're into photography and carry a powerful tele-lens everywhere. The view can be breath-taking. The pictures I'm posting here were made with my Mi Note 14 pro phone but the "real" ones, taken with a Nikon and  650mm tele-lens are something else. If you can, go early in the morning or late in the evening as the sun, at the time I was there, shines from the opposite side making images quite flat. The V19 bus will leave you, on it's last stop, a mere 200 meters (climb) from the top, making it very convenient. The Catalan "old" people we met in the bust were very helpful, in contrast with the younger locals who are definitely not well educated and oblivious to the importance of the impact of tourism in Barcelona's economy. Tourists should behave and be civil, locals should be demanding and   helpful. Seems youngsters have abused the Bunkers recently, throwing load raves with lots of drinking and drugs abuse, and the local management closes the access to this place before sundown, nowadays. A pity. I bet the sunset, seen from here must be amazing. Keep the Bunkers on your shortlist of places to visit if you're into photography, anyway

places.address: Carrer de la Gran Vista, 96, Horta-Guinardó, 08032 Barcelona, Spain

places.generalDescription: Con Gracia is a modern Catalan restaurant that borrows from other cultures to create innovative and exciting dishes. The two tasting menus available at the restaurant offer something for everyone, with a range of interesting and unique flavors. If you're looking for something special then Con Gracia is definitely the place to go!

sources.snippet: Your romantic trip to Barcelona is incomplete if you miss  out on a meal at Con Gracia. With a wide variety of delicacies to choose from, this restaurant offers three exclusively curated menus serving you an authentic taste of Mediterranean cuisine. Address: Martinez de la Rosa 8, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Barcelona for Couples 2025

sources.snippet: One of Barcelona’s highest rated restaurants, the ‘Experiences’ menu treats you to nine dishes selected by the chef. Great if you love surprises!
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Romantic Things To Do in Barcelona in 2025

places.name: Con Gracia

reviews.text: What a hidden gem! Con Gràcia was one of the most unique dining experiences we have ever had. The food was so delicious. The ingredients were the finest & so fresh. The tuna tasted light it was caught that morning. Every dish was picture perfect. Our 2 servers were kind, funny, thoughtful….exquisite! They noticed my husband was left handed and asked him which hand he cuts his meat with! The details were just perfect. I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant for anyone wanting a unique experience in Barcelona. Also, we could not believe the price. We have had tasting menus 3-4 times this price. And not as good as Con Gracia!

What had an amazing evening at Con Gracia. We opted for the surprise menu and it was such fun to be surprised by beautifully presented plates and delicious food. Jose and his spouse served our meals and presented each of the exceptional dishes. It was an “experience” that we will remember of our visit to Barcelona. Highly recommended to anyone looking for an exceptional dinning experience!

We went for a special dinner and it was truly amazing. Both the owners paid some much attention to the details. It was theatrical - we were amazed by the show performed in front of us and the quality of the food. Definitely deserves a Michelin star and hopefully Jose will be recognised one day!!

We picked chefs surprised menu (one vegan - one with animal products) and both the menus were tailored for our preferences. Neither of us felt like we missed out anything because it usually happens elsewhere (either you find vegan or non vegan options)

I would like to thank the Con Gracia team for this experience

places.address: Carrer de Martínez de la Rosa, 8, Gràcia, 08012 Barcelona, Spain

places.generalDescription: Paradiso is a clandestine cocktail bar concealed behind a fridge door within a pastrami shop in Barcelona's trendy El Born neighborhood. Despite its popularity, it remains an intriguing and sought-after destination. The bar boasts a dimly lit ambiance and offers an array of imaginative cocktails and classic bar bites. Giacomo Giannotti, the mastermind behind the beautiful menu, sources seasonal ingredients from local farmers and producers to create tantalizing drinks.

sources.snippet: The romantic ambiance and wood interiors will surely remind you of paradise. Their unique cocktail combinations are enough to tantalize your taste buds. If you want to have a romantic date in the city but want a super-hidden location, this place will not disappoint you.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Barcelona

places.name: Paradiso

reviews.text:
I wanted to share my amazing experience at Paradiso which recently won the award for best cocktail bar in the world. I highly recommend it for a night out or for pre-drinks before a party.

We tried almost all the items on their small bar bites menu, and the food was excellent. The cocktails were truly exceptional, and the waiter even explained the story behind each drink, which was a lovely touch.

I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Barcelona!!

I was here first six years ago. I remembered at the time thinking that it was somewhere I would always recommend for pageantry and atmosphere, though at the time I felt as though some of the cocktails were a little unbalanced. This couldn't be further from the truth. The service was excellent, the bar still chic and professional and well cared for. All the drinks were balanced, well thought out, and expertly presented. I love the fact that non-alcoholic cocktails are in the mix with their main drinks- not added as an afterthought to the back of the menu. We had such a brilliant experience here; chapeau Paradiso!

The most unique cocktails I've ever seen. Incredibly professional and kind staff as well. Great atmosphere in the bar. The menu itself is a piece of art, I also liked the restrooms, they fit the name paradiso very well. The stay in this bar was a surprising experience for all senses. Thank you for the great experience, Federico and team!

places.address: Carrer de Rera Palau, 4, Ciutat Vella, 08003 Barcelona, Spain

places.generalDescription: Lasarte, nestled within the elegant Condes de Barcelona Hotel, is a culinary gem that showcases the artistry of renowned Basque chef Martin Berasategui. Since its inception in 2006, this sophisticated restaurant has captivated food enthusiasts with its innovative tasting menus and exquisite wine pairings. Under the expert guidance of Chef de Cuisine Paolo Casagrande, Lasarte has evolved into a must-visit destination for those seeking an unforgettable gastronomic experience.

sources.snippet: Lasarte Restaurant offers exquisite Spanish cuisine in an intimate, romantic setting. As a Michelin-starred establishment it offers high quality food, such as traditional paellas, tapas, seasonal vegetables, creamy flan and refreshing sorbets. Address: C/Mallorca, 259, 08008, Barcelona, Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Barcelona for Couples 2025

places.name: Lasarte

reviews.text: I enjoyed the €345 course. I regret that Google does not allow me to rate much higher than five stars... I interpreted it as a French-based creative dish, but is that correct? When I ate it while imagining the taste from the appearance of the dish, it was shown to be far beyond my expectations in terms of flavor, texture, aroma, and harmony. Personally, I was most impressed by the artichokes that blended with other ingredients such as mushrooms in a way I have never experienced before, the soup that brought together the depth of shrimp, and the unique approach to Wagyu beef that I have never seen in Japan. I also had a lot of high-quality wines, and was impressed by the value I felt at the bill. At other restaurants, there are cases where unnecessarily expensive items are served and the price tends to be inflated, but that is not the case at Lasarte. The service was also extremely sincere. I would definitely like to visit again.

Anyone giving this place less than five stars has forgotten what it means to go to places like this. The service was immaculate. The food was an experience with every bite. Could've been a good day for the restaurant or a bad one and I still would've had my mind blown. To say otherwise is pompous. Only critique would be to confirm the cost of certain add-ons like water and coffee.
Excellent textbook 3 star experience. Phenomenal service and dishes perfectly balanced with beautiful delicate and fresh flavors. If you want a flawless experience, I can only recommend it.

places.address: Carrer de Mallorca, 259, L'Eixample, 08008 Barcelona, Spain
